intro: Tolpis crithmifolia, commonly known as sea fennel, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shorelines. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, sharp odor reminiscent of fennel. Tolpis crithmifolia is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
